slides.title: Welcome to ACCA MA
slides.content:
# Management Accounting (MA)

MA provides tools for **internal decision-making** and planning.

## What You Will Learn

- **Cost Classification** - Types and behaviors
- **Budgeting** - Planning and control
- **Standard Costing** - Variance analysis
- **Performance** - Measurement techniques

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Cost accounting | 25% |
| Budgeting | 25% |
| Standard costing | 15% |
| Performance | 20% |
| Decision making | 15% |

slides.title: Cost Classification
slides.content:
# Types of Costs

## By Nature

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Materials | Raw materials |
| Labor | Wages, salaries |
| Overheads | Rent, utilities |

## By Behavior

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Fixed | Constant regardless of output |
| Variable | Changes with output |
| Semi-variable | Mixed behavior |
| Stepped | Fixed within range |

## By Function

- Production costs
- Administration costs
- Selling costs
- Distribution costs

slides.title: Cost-Volume-Profit Analysis
slides.content:
# CVP Analysis

## Break-Even Point

```
BEP (units) = Fixed Costs / Contribution per unit

Contribution = Selling Price - Variable Cost
```

## Example

```
Selling Price: $50
Variable Cost: $30
Fixed Costs: $100,000

Contribution: $50 - $30 = $20
BEP: $100,000 / $20 = 5,000 units
```

## Margin of Safety

```
MoS = Actual Sales - Break-Even Sales
MoS% = MoS / Actual Sales x 100
```

## C/S Ratio

```
C/S Ratio = Contribution / Sales
BEP ($) = Fixed Costs / C/S Ratio
```

slides.title: CVP Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: If fixed costs are $50,000 and contribution per unit is $10, what is the break-even point?

slides.title: Absorption Costing
slides.content:
# Absorption Costing

## Full Costing Method

All production costs absorbed into product cost.

## Cost Structure

```
Direct Materials
+ Direct Labor
+ Variable Overhead
+ Fixed Production Overhead
= Full Production Cost
```

## OAR Calculation

```
OAR = Budgeted Overhead / Budgeted Activity

Bases:
- Direct labor hours
- Machine hours
- Units produced
```

## Over/Under Absorption

```
Absorbed OH = Actual hours x OAR
Actual OH = Actual overhead incurred

Difference = Over or Under absorption
```

slides.title: Marginal Costing
slides.content:
# Marginal Costing

## Variable Costing Method

Only variable costs charged to products.

## Cost Structure

```
Direct Materials
+ Direct Labor
+ Variable Overhead
= Marginal Cost

Fixed costs = Period cost
```

## Contribution Statement

```
Sales Revenue           100,000
Less: Variable Costs    (60,000)
--------------------------
Contribution             40,000
Less: Fixed Costs       (25,000)
--------------------------
Profit                   15,000
```

## Absorption vs Marginal

| Feature | Absorption | Marginal |
|---------|------------|----------|
| Fixed OH | Product cost | Period cost |
| Inventory | Higher value | Lower value |
| Profit | May differ | May differ |

slides.title: Budgeting
slides.content:
# Budget Process

## Types of Budgets

| Budget | Purpose |
|--------|--------|
| Sales | Revenue forecast |
| Production | Units to make |
| Materials | Material needs |
| Labor | Labor hours |
| Cash | Cash flows |
| Master | Summary |

## Budget Preparation Order

```
Sales Budget
    |
    v
Production Budget
    |
    v
Material, Labor, Overhead
    |
    v
Cash Budget
    |
    v
Master Budget
```

## Production Budget

```
Sales demand
+ Closing inventory required
- Opening inventory
= Production units needed
```

slides.title: Flexible Budgets
slides.content:
# Flexible Budgeting

## Fixed vs Flexible

| Type | Adjusts for |
|------|------------|
| Fixed | One activity level |
| Flexible | Actual activity |

## Example

```
Original Budget: 10,000 units
Actual Activity: 12,000 units

Flexible Budget:
- Variable costs: 12,000 x rate
- Fixed costs: Same as original
```

## Variance Calculation

```
Flexible Budget Variance:
Actual - Flexed Budget

Volume Variance:
Flexed Budget - Fixed Budget
```

## Benefits

- Meaningful comparisons
- Fair performance evaluation
- Better control

slides.title: Standard Costing
slides.content:
# Standard Costing

## What are Standards?

Predetermined costs for products/activities.

## Types of Standards

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Ideal | Perfect conditions |
| Attainable | Challenging but achievable |
| Current | Expected normal |
| Basic | Long-term unchanged |

## Setting Standards

```
Material Standard:
- Standard quantity per unit
- Standard price per unit

Labor Standard:
- Standard hours per unit
- Standard rate per hour
```

slides.title: Variance Analysis
slides.content:
# Variance Analysis

## Material Variances

```
Price Variance:
(Standard price - Actual price) x Actual qty

Usage Variance:
(Standard qty - Actual qty) x Standard price
```

## Labor Variances

```
Rate Variance:
(Std rate - Actual rate) x Actual hours

Efficiency Variance:
(Std hours - Actual hours) x Std rate
```

## Interpreting Variances

| Variance | F (Favorable) | A (Adverse) |
|----------|--------------|-------------|
| Price | Paid less | Paid more |
| Usage | Used less | Used more |
| Rate | Lower rate | Higher rate |
| Efficiency | Fewer hours | More hours |

slides.title: Overhead Variances
slides.content:
# Overhead Variances

## Fixed Overhead

```
Expenditure Variance:
Budgeted FOH - Actual FOH

Volume Variance:
(Budgeted units - Actual units) x OAR
```

## Variable Overhead

```
Expenditure Variance:
(Std rate x Actual hrs) - Actual VOH

Efficiency Variance:
(Std hrs - Actual hrs) x Std rate
```

## Reconciliation

```
Budgeted Profit
+/- Material variances
+/- Labor variances
+/- Overhead variances
= Actual Profit
```

slides.title: Variance Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: If actual hours exceed standard hours, the labor efficiency variance is?

slides.title: Performance Measurement
slides.content:
# Performance Indicators

## Financial Measures

| Measure | Formula |
|---------|--------|
| ROI | PBIT / Capital Employed |
| RI | PBIT - (CE x Cost of Capital) |
| ROCE | PBIT / CE x 100 |

## Non-Financial Measures

| Area | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Quality | Defect rates, returns |
| Delivery | On-time delivery % |
| Customer | Satisfaction scores |
| Efficiency | Capacity utilization |

## Balanced Scorecard

- Financial perspective
- Customer perspective
- Internal process
- Learning and growth

slides.title: Decision Making
slides.content:
# Short-term Decisions

## Relevant Costs

| Relevant | Irrelevant |
|----------|------------|
| Future | Past (sunk) |
| Cash flows | Non-cash |
| Incremental | Committed |

## Decision Types

| Decision | Key Factor |
|----------|------------|
| Make or buy | Cost comparison |
| Special order | Contribution |
| Limiting factor | Contribution/factor |
| Shutdown | Avoidable costs |

## Limiting Factor

```
Contribution per unit / Limiting factor per unit
= Contribution per limiting factor

Rank products by this ratio
```

slides.title: Pricing Decisions
slides.content:
# Pricing Methods

## Cost-Plus Pricing

```
Full Cost + Markup = Price

Markup % = Target Profit / Cost x 100
```

## Marginal Cost Pricing

```
Variable Cost + Contribution = Price

Useful for:
- Special orders
- Competitive bids
- Spare capacity
```

## Target Costing

```
Market Price - Target Profit = Target Cost

Cost reduction to achieve target
```

## Pricing Strategies

| Strategy | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| Penetration | Low price, gain share |
| Skimming | High initial price |
| Premium | High quality, high price |

slides.title: Process Costing
slides.content:
# Process Costing

## When Used

- Continuous production
- Identical products
- Mass manufacturing

## Equivalent Units

```
Physically complete units
+ (WIP units x % complete)
= Equivalent units
```

## Cost per Equivalent Unit

```
Total costs / Equivalent units
= Cost per equivalent unit
```

## Losses

| Type | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| Normal | Cost absorbed |
| Abnormal | Separate account |
